doc.field: 21 Letters, 1 United States Postal Card with Postage
Addressed To: "Mr. / Professor E.N. [Eben Norton] Horsford" ; "Mr. Gilman"

Sent From: "Constance Winsor, 74 Sparks Street, Cambridge," [MA], [Daughter of Justin Winsor] ; "Justin Winsor, 74 Sparks Street, Cambridge," [MA], "Editor of Narrative & Critical History Of America, The Memorial History of Boston, Cambridge," [MA], "Librarian Justin Winsor, The Corporation of Harvard College, Harvard College, Cambridge, MA / Harvard College Library, Gore Hall, Cambridge, MA" ; "Mrs. Justin Winsor, [Caroline Tufts Barker]"

In Reference To: Academic / Education / Friendship / History / Personal / Social; American Historical Association; "Champlain's Voyages" ; "Harriet, the Moses of Her People" ; "How I Came By A Berghem by E.N.H. & Souvenir of Wellesley College, 1888" ; Charles River; Houghton, Mifflin & Company; "The Problem of the Northmen / Letter to Judge Daly" ; Wellesley College, Alice Elvira Freeman Palmer

Justin Winsor (January 2, 1831 â€“ October 22, 1897) was an American historian, librarian, and writer. Winsor's historical work had strong bibliographical and cartographical elements; he was also an authority on the early history of North America. Winsor archival material is preserved at the Houghton Library at Harvard College in Cambridge, MA and the Massachusetts Historical Society in Boston, MA.
Winsor, Constance & Justin: Cambridge, MA : 1886 May 12 & 26; 1887 November 1; 1889 February 8; undated, circa 1880s
Winsor, Constance & Justin: Cambridge, MA : 1886 May 12 & 26; 1887 November 1; 1889 February 8; undated, circa 1880s
